description.narrative: Financial Statements: The presented Financial statements are for Instituto para Democracia Multipartidária (IMD), related to the period from 1st January 2018 to 31st December 2018 and the summary of a significant accounting policies and other explanations notes, this financial statement comprises the total budget execution and the consolidated Cash Flow for the 2018 executed programs, the IMD Balance Sheet for the period ended at 31st December 2018 and each explanation notes; Financial Statements presentations and disclosures: The Financial Statements where prepared and presented in accordance with the accounting principles standards acceptable in Mozambique, and in accordance with the management standards agreed with donors disclosed in the projects notes 1 to 7. This financial statement, were prepared for assessing the IMD’s ability to continue as a going concern, disclosing, as applicable, matters related to going concern and using the going concern basis of accounting. The presented Financial Statements are as at 31st December 2018. The presented Financial Statements are prepared in Euros, being the contract currency with the donor, and also presents the counterparts in Metical as a principal currency in force in Mozambique. This Financial Statements presents each projects balance and its explanations notes, and principal disclosures as at 31st December 2018.

provider-org.ref: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Finland DEMO FILAND -Improving oversight in Mozambique´s Governance program
provider-org.narrative: Improving Oversight in Mozambique´s Governance, is a joint project of Instituto para Democracia Multipartidária (IMD), Netherlands Institute for Multiparty Democracy (NIMD) and Political Parties of Finland for Democracy (Demo Finland), funded by the Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland (MFA), as part of the Ministry´s Country Strategy for Development in Mozambique in 2016-2019. The MFA has made available, on a grant basis and subject to annual parliamentary approval in Finland, a Grant amounting up to a maximum of one million five hundred thousand Euros (EURO 1 500 000) to support the implementation of the Project during the period between 1st of December 2016 and 30th November 2019. The project Improving Oversight of Mozambique´s Governance: has a goal to Strengthening the Role of the Parliament and of Provincial Assemblies in the Oversight of the Extractive Industry Area in Mozambique.

receiver-org.narrative: The implementing partners in the Project are the following organizations 1. The Netherlands Institute for Multiparty Democracy (NIMD). 2. Instituto para Democracia Multipartidária (IMD). 3. Political Parties of Finland for Democracy – (Demo Finland).

provider-org.ref: Netherlands Institute for Multiparty Democracy -Strategic Partnership program
provider-org.narrative: The Netherlands Institute for Multiparty Democracy (NIMD). NIMD is a democracy assistance organization that promotes the deepening of democracy through interparty dialogue and capacity strengthening of political parties. With its origins in the Netherlands, NIMD was founded by seven Dutch political parties and works with over 200 political parties in more than 20 countries in Africa, Asia, Latin America, the Middle East and South Caucasus. Main donors of NIMD are the Ministry for Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands, European Union, Swiss MFA, UNDP, US State Department, supporting the following areas: i) Joint initiatives by parties to improve the democratic system in their country; ii) The institutional development of political parties; and iii) Efforts to improve relations between political parties, civil society and the media.

receiver-org.narrative: In order to enable the political parties in Mozambique to contribute in an effective way to the democratic reforms, NIMD in Partnership with IMD continued to invest on interparty dialogue platform and direct support for capacity building of parliamentary political parties.

provider-org.ref: Open Society Initiative for Southern Africa (OSISA) OSISA - Peace Building program;
provider-org.narrative: The project, Integrity and Peaceful Elections, with financial support from OSISA, has a major implementation challenge because despite the 26th anniversary of the signing of a peace agreement, Mozambique remains a country marked essentially by moments of relative peace and violence, as a result of electoral processes almost always conducted in a climate of distrust. Thus, with the project "Integrity and Peaceful Elections", the AIMD aims to contribute to the monitoring and prevention of potential conflicts that characterized elections in Mozambique.

receiver-org.narrative: In general, the toolkit clarifies the role of the different actors in the electoral process, as follows: 1. Political parties (proponents) - have the role of participating in the electoral process, civic education / electoral mobilization, and oversight of the electoral process; 2. Electoral Management Body (EMB) - have the role of baking, budgeting, informing and ensuring the electoral process according to the electoral calendar; 3. Civil society organizations - They should contribute to the promotion of democratic rule of law and the revolution of conflicts; 4. Social Communication - can be a source of conflict as well as contribute to its prevention and resolution. They are expected to play their role impartially, citing sources that are credible, sensitive criticism and equal treatment of different actors, serving only as an intermediary. They should avoid sensationalism. According to SADC principles, they should treat the different actors equally, avoid speculation, polling, and disseminate interim results; 5. Constitutional Council (and district courts) - wherever called, can contribute to conflict resolution through swift, impartial, law-based and reasonableness action.
